So it turns out that when the government refuses to do its job in a natural disaster, victims are to just suffer it out, as citizens helping flood-stranded victims is a big no-no with the government.

Helicopter pilot threatened with arrest after flying rescue missions in flood-ravaged NC https://t.co/EStAq47oJa pic.twitter.com/GDRSjZOBJe
— New York Post (@nypost)
title: Pilot Threatened With Arrest For Flying Into North Carolina And Saving Hurricane Victims

If someone is concerned that a certain group of people may become violent over a train ticket, wouldn’t that be a sign that they don’t belong?

German train conductors have been instructed to skip “newcomers” because migrant passengers have started threatening staff over requests to provide proof of payment.

Unsure if Germany has this little thing called “equality under the law” but it does not seem fair that citizens don’t get free train rides.

Train staff in Thuringia, Germany have been
title: Train Conductors Instructed To Skip - Ahem - "Newcomers" Over Concerns They Will Become Violent

It turns out that when a bureaucratic organization prioritizes “equity” above life, you get the disaster that continues to unfold in North Carolina.

North Carolina residents continue to fight for survival while FEMA has barely made an appearance. Any help these hurricane victims have received seems to have mostly come from private citizens or companies.

One of the reasons why
title: FEMA Prioritizing Equity In Hurricane Disaster Assistance As Residents Fend For Themselves

According to MSNBC’s Nicolle Wallace, JD Vance fact-checking lying moderators is “mansplaining” but if the two women are that pathetic they cannot listen to a man explain, they have no business pretending to moderate the Vice Presidential debate on national TV.

A reminder that it was John McCain's dying wish that she not show up at his funeral. https://t.co/DUd3a5ZhwD
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire)
title: Watch: MSNBC dingbat claims JD Vance's "worst" moment of the debate was his... mansplaining?

description:
Brazilian journalists Paulo Figueiredo and Allan dos Santos sat down with me to detail the concerning similarities between Brazil and the United States today. Both journalists are victim of censorship, and are currently in exile in the United States — being targets of Brazilian Supreme Court minister Alexandre de Moraes. Their stories are powerful and should concern every American.

Jornalistas brasileiros Paulo Figueiredo e Allan dos Santos participaram do programa e detalham similaridades preocupantes entre o Brasil e EUA. Os dois são vitimas da censura e perseguidos pelo ministro do STF, Alexandre de Moraes. O que eles dizem aqui é importante para todos os Americanos ouvirem.

Subscribe to Louder with Crowder on Rumble! Download the app on Apple
title: “Brazil is a Cautionary Tale” — Ash Wednesday with Paulo Figueiredo and Allan dos Santos

description:
Subscribe to Louder with Crowder on Rumble! Download the app on Apple and Google Play.

We here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website had been looking forward to the vice presidential debate since we thought it would be JD Vance vs. Kamala Harris. Once Democrats made the switch to Tim Walz, our expectations were even higher. Vance is a master debater. The only thing Walz has master debated was a horse (allegedly). Last night was such a one-sided schlacking, it may go down as the one time a VP debate changed the course of an election. There were three key points... and a lot of hilarious Jim Halpert memes.

But first, I'm not one to say I t
title: Three key moments of JD Vance's dominance over Tim Walz, moderators (and what Trump needs to NOT do next)
